firstNightReminder: Show the Hostage the character token of the Demon in play.
name: Hostage
ability: You start knowing which Demon is in play. If an evil player publicly guesses you (once), 2 good players die.

firstNightReminder: The Doctor points at a player: Tell them 'yes' if that player is drunk, poisoned, or sick, otherwise, tell them 'no'.
otherNightReminder: The Doctor points at a player: Tell them 'yes' if that player is drunk, poisoned, or sick, otherwise, tell them 'no'.
name: Doctor
ability: Each night, choose a player (not yourself): you learn if they are either drunk, poisoned, or sick, but you do not learn which.

firstNightReminder: The Cleric can point at two players: Remove any 'poisoned', 'drunk' or 'sick' markers from those players. Afterwards, remove any 'poisoned' markers from the Cleric.
otherNightReminder: The Cleric can point at two players: Remove any 'poisoned', 'drunk' or 'sick' markers from those players. If they did this the night before, do not wake them tonight. Afterwards, remove any 'poisoned' markers from the Cleric.
name: Cleric
ability: Each night, you may choose 2 players: they are cured from drunkenness, poison & sickness. If you used your ability the night before, you may not use it again until the next night. If you are poisoned, it only lasts for 1 night.

otherNightReminder: The Knight points at a player: Place the 'protected' marker next to them. If the Knight is drunk or poisoned, place the 'protected' marker next to the Knight instead.
name: Knight
ability: Each night*, choose a player (not yourself): They are protected from the demon. If you are drunk or poisoned, you protect yourself instead.

otherNightReminder: Show the Grave Robber the character token of the player who was executed today. If they are drunk, also show them the character token of one of that player's neighbors.
name: Grave Robber
ability: Each night*, you learn the character of the player who was executed the day before. If you are drunk, you also learn the character of one of their neighbors. All information you receive is correct, unless you are poisoned.

firstNightReminder: Ask the Paladin if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Paladin will point at a player: Place the 'immune to poison & drunk' marker next to that player and remove any 'poisoned' or 'drunk' markers from that player. If the chosen player is evil, mark the Paladin as 'sick' at the start of the next night.
otherNightReminder: If the Paladin has not used their ability yet, ask the Paladin if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Paladin will point at a player: Place the 'immune to poison & drunk' marker next to that player and remove any 'poisoned' or 'drunk' markers from that player. If the chosen player is evil, mark the Paladin as 'sick'.
name: Paladin
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player (not yourself): They are immune to drunkenness and poison. If the player you chose is evil, you become sick. (If it's the first night, you only become sick after dusk on the first day.)

firstNightReminder: Ask the Fairy Godmother if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Fairy Godmother will point at a player and a character with an action: Mark that player as 'blessed' and that character with '1 use of'. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Fairy Godmother. Show them the character token of the ability they may now use.
otherNightReminder: If the Fairy Godmother has not used their ability yet, ask the Fairy Godmother if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Fairy Godmother will point at a player and a character with an action: Mark that player as 'blessed' and that character with '1 use of'. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Fairy Godmother. Show them the character token of the ability they may now use.
name: Fairy Godmother
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player (not yourself) and a good character with an action (anything that involves choosing a player or character): That player can perform that character's action once.

firstNightReminder: Ask the Nurse if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Nurse will point at a character who can act once per game: If that player has used their ability already, remove the 'used' marker from that player. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Nurse.
otherNightReminder: If the Nurse has not used their ability yet, ask the Nurse if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Nurse will point at a character who can act once per game: If that player has used their ability already, remove the 'used' marker from that player. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Nurse.
name: Nurse
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player (not yourself) and a good character with an action (anything that involves choosing a player or character): That player can perform that character's action once.

otherNightReminder: Doesn't wake. If the Glutton was killed by the Demon tonight, place the 'drunk 2' marker next to the Demon. The next night, place the 'drunk 1' marker next to the demon.
name: Glutton
ability: You are immune to sickness, drunkenness and poisoning. If the demon kills you, they are drunk for 2 days and 1 night.

name: Hero
ability: You cannot be killed by the Demon. If you are executed, a different player becomes the Hero. If you die by means other than execution, 2 more players die. 2 players also die if you are poisoned, but not if you are drunk.

firstNightReminder: Show the Lover 1 of the bluffs you showed the Demon.
name: Lover
ability: The Demon might register as good or as a Townsfolk or Outsider, even if either of you is dead. You might register as evil or as a Demon, even if you are dead. You start knowing 1 Demon bluff.

name: Skeptic
ability: You do not know you are the Skeptic. You think you are a different Outsider & will register as that Outsider, but your ability malfunctions. On the first day, after dusk, you and both of your neighbors become sick.

firstNightReminder: The Mourner points at a player: Mark that player as 'drunk'.
otherNightReminder: The Mourner points at a player: Mark that player as 'drunk'.
name: Mourner
ability: Each night, choose a player (not yourself): They are drunk until the end of the following day. If you die, publicly choose one final living player. If they are good, they are drunk until the end of the game.

firstNightReminder: The Druid points at up to 2 players: If they point at 1, mark that player as 'poisoned'. If they point at 2, mark one as 'poisoned', and the other as 'poisoned, knows'. Wake that second player and tell them they have been selected by the Druid.
otherNightReminder: The Druid points at up to 2 players: If they point at 1, mark that player as 'poisoned'. If they point at 2, mark one as 'poisoned', and the other as 'poisoned, knows'. Wake that second player and tell them they have been selected by the Druid.
name: Druid
ability: Each night, choose up to 2 players: They are poisoned until the end of the following day. If you choose more than 1 player, 1 will know they are poisoned.

firstNightReminder: Ask the Renegade Fairy if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Renegade Fairy will point at a player and a character with an action: Mark that player as ''blessed'' and that character with '1 bad use of'. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Fairy Godmother if they're good, or by the Renegade Fairy if they're evil. Show them the character token of the faulty ability they may now use.
otherNightReminder: If the Renegade Fairy has not used their ability yer, ask the Renegade Fairy if they want to use their ability. If they do, the Renegade Fairy will point at a player and a character with an action: Mark that player as ''blessed'' and that character with '1 bad use of'. Wake that player and tell them they were selected by the Fairy Godmother if they're good, or by the Renegade Fairy if they're evil. Show them the character token of the faulty ability they may now use.
name: Renegade Fairy
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player (not yourself) & a good character with an action: That player can perform that character's action once & it will work so that it benefits you. You might register as the Fairy Godmother to good players.

firstNightReminder: The Centurion points at 2 players, 1 of which is good: Mark those players as 'faulty'.
otherNightReminder: The Centurion points at 2 players, 1 of which is good: Mark those players as 'faulty'.
name: Centurion
ability: Each night, choose two players (not yourself, 1 must be good): The next day, the first vote they both don't participate in, fails.

name: Advisor
ability: If a player you nominated dies, their next good neighbors become poisoned for the rest of the game.

otherNightReminder: Doesn't wake. Mark a living neighbor to the plague or to a living sick player as 'sick'.
name: Plague
ability: Each night*, an alive neighbor (to you or an alive sick player) becomes sick, even if you are dead. If you die, the game continues. You also win if all remaining living players are sick. Good wins if you are dead and no-one is sick.

otherNightReminder: The Shadow points at a character with a night action: If that character is in play, place the 'kills' marker next to them. Later that night, place the 'dies' marker(s) next to the player(s) said player picks.
name: Shadow
ability: Each night*, choose a good character with a night action: if in play, whomever that player chooses, dies (including you). The first time you die, whichever living player you last chose to kill for you becomes the new evil Shadow.

otherNightReminder: The Priam points at a player: That player dies. If the Priam is drunk, show them the hand sign for '2' and the Priam points at 2 players: Both die.
name: Priam
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. If you are drunk, choose 2 players: both die. If a vote to execute you passes and there are more than 3 alive players, it fails instead. [-1 Minion] [+1 Outsider]
